title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Planning)
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Planning) 

(Habitats, Birds and Environmental Impact) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 9th day of September

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: 2. Section 42 (amended by subsection (1) of section 28 of the Planning and
text_raw:
2. Section 42 (amended by subsection (1) of section 28 of the Planning and 
Development (Housing) and Residential Tenancies Act 2016 (No. 17 of 2016)) 
of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) is amended – 

(a) 

in subsection (1), by – 

(i) 

the substitution of “On application to it in that behalf, but 
subject to subsection (8),” for “On application to it in that 
behalf”, and 

(ii) 

the deletion of clause (II) of subparagraph (i) of paragraph 
(a), 

(b) 

in subsection (1A), by – 

(i) 

(ii) 

the substitution of “Notwithstanding anything to the 
contrary in subsection (1) or (4) but subject to subsection 
(8)” for “Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in 
subsection (1) or (4)”, and 

the substitution of 
subparagraph (i) paragraph (a): 

the following subparagraph for 

“(i) 

in relation to permission for development consisting 
of the construction of not less than 20 houses,”, and 

(c) 

the insertion of the following subsection: 

1 OJ No. L206 of 27 July 1992, p.7 
2 OJ No. L20 of 26 January 2010, p.7 
3 OJ No. L26 of 28 January 2012, p.1 
4 OJ No. L124 of 25 April 2014, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th September, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [456] 3 

“(8) A planning authority shall not extend the appropriate 
period under this section in relation to a permission if an 
environmental impact assessment or an appropriate assessment 
would be required in relation to the proposed extension 
concerned.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 September, 2021. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [456]

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations amend section 42 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 
by deleting clause (II) of subparagraph (i) of paragraph (a) of subsection (1) of 
section 42, which requires a planning authority to be satisfied that an 
environmental impact assessment or an appropriate assessment was not required 
before the original permission was granted prior to consenting to an extension of 
duration of the appropriate period of a planning permission. 

These Regulations insert a new subsection (8) into section 42 the Planning and 
Development Act 2000, which states that a planning authority shall not extend 
the appropriate period under this section in relation to a permission if an 
environmental impact assessment or an appropriate assessment would be 
required in relation to the proposed extension, and amend subsections (1) and 
(1A) of section 42 to require that any decision regarding the extension or further 
extension of an appropriate period of a permission under those subsections is 
subject to subsection (8) of that section. The Regulations come into force on 9 
September 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [456] 5
